summary: Professor Sherman Klump (Eddie Murphy) is getting married. And the Klump family could not be more delighted. His fiancee Denise (Janet Jackson) is thrilled to become a Klump, and with her appetite she'll fit right in. But Buddy Love ... well, Buddy is another matter.

reviews.content: 83/100 - Funny. Watch the first minute and it will tell you everything you need to know about this film. Its freakin hilarious! The banter between the father and grandmother-in-law is actually so funny.
Fantastique mon ami, c'est un masterpiece

O gênero comédia não me atrai, entretanto a atuação impecável, dinâmica e diversificada de Eddie Murphy é simplesmente apaixonante, não tem como você não admirar o trabalho formidável realizado, uma comédia divertida, simples e cativante, uma continuação bonitinha, onde. Alto São os familiares do protagonistas todos com atuação perfeita de Murphy...

confusing,cgi really bad,its very bland is just me are is eddie in kinda of lot of bad things when he is the star of the movie he is in good things like sherk,2,4,1 and this movie is wired were is jada penkins lets get rid of her for reason idk i think this movie has a decent final battle he water its very wired.its a very wired movie to very very disspointing no were near better the the first one.
This is a film that's hard to take seriously but Murphy keeps it reasonably watchable
Eddie Murphy is hilarious, this much is consistent from the first movie.  The sequel has a bad script and skits that sometimes miss their mark.
Typical fall flat sequel

Nutty Professor II is far from being one of the worst comedy sequels out there with a good laugh to be had every once in a while and Eddie Murphy once again doing a great job with each individual family member (and Buddy Love) that it's genuinely hard to remember that you're watching the same guy crossdress and talk to himself. Where it falls short is in its decision to rehash elements from its predecessor, Janet Jackson's character being such a blatant carbon copy of Jada Pinkett recently Smith that it makes one wonder why they made her a different character to begin with and the Klumps being less funnier in larger doses, not helped at all by the fact that their status as ascended extras ultimately has no effect on the plot. The Klumps is watchable - I prefer this Eddie Murphy sequel over Beverly Hills Cop III anyway - but is it any good? No dice.
At least the first one had a little charm. This isn't a 2 movie kind of thing. It's barely a one movie kind of thing.
the script is very bad but the characters are very nice.

Nutty Professor 2's humor is apparently way worse the second go around, but it still retains the spirit of the original with a kind of decent story, and Eddie Murphy's hilarious presence as the Klump family, which there is plenty of.
It's a funny movie lots of laughter. Good time and corny!

Quite a rollick, though where the story went it was going to be about the family, instead of where the plot went. If the movie was based off them eating at a table for ninety minutes, I would've been fine with that. Some parts were hysterical, other parts went nowhere, and some were gross out. When I saw this I was younger and I found it funny. Even still today, it's funny but it should've been hysterical instead of being put in a sour note. I would rated this a three star rating, but so much humor you can quote it to this day it ranks it higher. It's worth a watch. I think you'll enjoy it.
Great fun. The low ratings doesn't mean anything.
It does receive a chuckle or some laughs from here and there, but still, this movie is bad. Not the worst (it's still watchable), just bad.
The plot is pretty dire, but there's enough laughs to make up for some of it
Another inferior sequel from Murphy and one of his most annoying films. Every joke is over cooked and this film is a mess. Even Murphy fans will get indigestion from watching this!
its not better then the original in any way but it still does something different instead of coping the first movie.
I like it. It is silly but I did like it
A cash grab sequel, with bad CGI and a funny Murphy performance.
Just stop, what next Norbit two?
The first movie is better than this
This movie is so funny and so bad it's good.
The sequel is really just terrible...

there are thousands of pee your pants hilarious lines from murphy's 80's movies & stand up...but "i wanna put my beef in your taco" from the professor to janet jackson alone makes this a 3 star instead of 1 :)

So forgettable, that I've met people who didn't even know that " The Nutty Professor" had a sequel.
Stick to the first Nutty Professor.
Laugh out loud funny every time!
***Due to the recent RT changes that have basically ruined my past reviews, I am mostly only giving a rating rather than a full review.***
Absolutely fantastic and hilarious.  I wish Eddie Murphy would do some more comedies like this.  He is super talented and funny.
This Movie Sucked.The First Was So Much Better.But Had Some Funny Parts.Why Is It Even Call The Klumps.C-

The first film wasn't that refined to start with, but this sequel makes it look like a masterpiece in subtlety. The same types of fat jokes are done here, but in more obvious, gross ways, and other bizarre types of humor belch their way across the screen too, such as bestiality jokes, incest jokes, and sex jokes. Plus, every joke has an off sense of timing, as if each gag were rushed and filled with actors who look and act like deer caught in the headlights. The charm of the first film is completely gone, leaving this dead, joyless affair in its wake.
The watershed moment where Murphy went from hilarious to unbearable. Utter garbage.

A good movie with lots of hilarious remarks but is simply crude. One of the crudest movies I've ever seen with poop jokes, fart jokes, and every kind of different crude jokes. But it is a good sequel true to it first.
Murphy sequel is slightly better than original and has more sexual humor. Ages 13+
Better than the heartfelt original
While Murphy is at his best (at times) and the makeup work is great, this is a lazy, dumb-down Hollywood sequel that does no justice to the previous movie.
The first Nutty Professor played off its premise without trying too hard, but the second one is juts plain vulgar, idiotic, and quite manic. Steer clear.

No where as funny as original. This time, he creates a formula to make the user younger. His love interest this time is Janet Jackson and she does ok. My main complaint with this is that is just not funny. Spoofs of Armageddon and Star Wars are completely out of place. Way too many fart jokes and doesn't have anything nearly as good as the first film.

Not as funny as the first one. The humor feels lazier, relying on adult/sex-themed jokes for laughs and it goes on for so long it gets tiring and boring. Just cheap, lazy jokes/humor.

Though it has a few good laughs, this sequel falls short because of overly gross humor and ridiculousness.

Ni el carisma, ni humor de Eddie Murphy pueden evitar que esta secuela sea un lastimero y mediocre nuevo capítulo de "The Nutty Professor" que cae en el humor de inodoro más profundo que su predecesora.
